cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 135 miles ESE of Jacksonville, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north-northwest today, then turning north and north-northeast Thursday while paralleling the Georgia coast before approaching South Carolina/North Carolina and heading into the western Atlantic.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the South Carolina coast (around Charleston area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Ponte Vedra Beach, FL to Savannah River, GA
weather_observation.warning_coast: Sebastian Inlet, FL to the Volusia/Brevard County line FL and north of Ponte Vedra Beach, FL to Savannah River, GA (includes Brunswick area)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coast from central Florida through Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) are expected at the port today into Thursday; brief hurricane-force gusts cannot be ruled out if the core passes closer.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 3–5 ft above ground level possible along the Georgia coast, including the Brunswick area, especially at high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches with isolated totals up to 9 inches along the Georgia coast could cause flash flooding in and around the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; isolated tornadoes possible as the outer rain-bands sweep across coastal Georgia.
